alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Gabriel Mountains; Interstate 5 Corridor; Northern Ventura County Mountains; Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains; Southern Ventura County Mountains; Western San Gabriel Mountains and Highway 14 Corridor (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 02 at 9:42AM PST until January 04 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM WEDNESDAY TO 10 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Moderate snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches likely, with isolated amounts up to 8 inches possible across higher elevations. There is a 30 percent chance of 1- 2 inch snow accumulations down to 4000 feet, including I-5 at Tejon Pass. Snow levels will generally range between 4500 and 5000 feet early Wednesday then could fall as low as 4000 feet late Wednesday into Wednesday night, which could impact I-5 at Tejon Pass. Northwest winds will be increasing Wednesday afternoon into Wednesday night with gusts in the 35 to 50 mph range. * WHERE...The mountains of Los Angeles and Ventura counties, as well as the Santa Barbara interior mountains. * WHEN...From 3 AM Wednesday to 10 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, with potential for delays and closures. I-5 near Tejon Pass will potentially see snow, ice, and gusty winds, which could cause significant travel delays. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The gusty winds could bring reduced visibilities in blowing snow, especially Wednesday afternoon into Wednesday night. A second and potentially colder storm system could impact the local mountains this weekend, potentially bringing snow levels as low as 3000 feet.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions from CalTrans are available by calling 1 800 4 2 7 7 6 2 3.
